bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to Edwin F. Uhl, May 6, 1895
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General of United States, Monrovia, Liberia, May 6, 1895.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. JUL 3 1895 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
Consulate General of United States, Monrovia, Liberia, May 6, 1895.
To the Hon. Edwin F. Uhle, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to most respectfully ask for the following supplies for this office 2 letter files Sealing wax Diplomatic and consular Envelopes, medium Blank Drafts, Duplicates preferred Office table, Des with pigeon holes, Office Chair, Blanks for Fransis Account, Blanks receipts for reuh, Joint Certificates for outgoing
I am obediently William H. Heard Minister Resident and Con. General
